title: Treat Heat Exhaustion
brief: Treat heat exhaustion caused by large loss of body water and salt.
steps: Step 1: Recognize symptoms: headache, mental confusion, irritability, excessive sweating, weakness, dizziness, cramps, pale/moist/cold skin.
Step 2: Immediately move patient to shade.
Step 3: Have patient lie on stretcher or elevated surface about 45 centimeters off the ground.
Step 5: Sprinkle patient with water and fan to increase cooling.
Step 6: Give patient small amounts of water every 3 minutes.
Step 7: Ensure patient stays quiet and rests completely.
warnings: Heat exhaustion can progress to life-threatening heat stroke if not treated promptly.
Do not give large amounts of water at once - small frequent sips are better.
Monitor patient closely for worsening symptoms.
